well....i do that to see what is the last thing that has been logged via syslog daemon before failure happens....in common you use async mounted partitions....and async logging. means that syslogd writes data to disc when some buffer has been filled. if you use sync mounting and sync logging.....it MAY log the thing that caused your crash...
